By the time students get to college, they’re expected to be proficient at learning independently, without the support of a group. But at the University of Minnesota-Rochester, group work is a core part of the curriculum. ARW producer Emily Hanford discusses how this emerging program is veering away from the traditional lecture format in an effort to better suit the needs of the modern college student.

contentencoded: By the time students get to college, they’re expected to be proficient at learning independently, without the support of a group. But at the University of Minnesota-Rochester, group work is a core part of the curriculum. ARW producer Emily Hanford discusses how this emerging program is veering away from the traditional lecture format in an effort to better suit the needs of the modern college student.
